title: Mark Szücs
text:
Mark Szücs (born November 4, 1976 in <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a>, <a href="Ontario">Ontario</a>) is a <a href="Canadians">Canadian</a>-born <a href="Austrians">Austrian</a> former professional <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> <a href="winger%20%28ice%20hockey%29">left winger</a>. 
Szücs spent four seasons in <a href="Union%20Dutchmen%20ice%20hockey">Union College</a> before moving to <a href="Austria">Austria</a> in 1999 with <a href="VEU%20Feldkirch">VEU Feldkirch</a>. In 2000 he moved to <a href="EHC%20Black%20Wings%20Linz">EHC Black Wings Linz</a> where he remained until his retirement in 2010, playing over 400 games for the team. He has worked as an assistant coach for Linz since retiring as a player.
He became an Austrian citizen and played for the <a href="Austria%20men%27s%20national%20ice%20hockey%20team">Austria national team</a> in the <a href="2002%20IIHF%20World%20Championship">2002</a>, <a href="2003%20IIHF%20World%20Championship">2003</a> and <a href="2004%20IIHF%20World%20Championship">2004</a> <a href="IIHF%20World%20Championship">IIHF World Championship</a>.
